isis.stitle: T 444E Diesel Engine Diagnostics (NAVPAK) (1997) - SECTION 3.5: ELECTRONIC CONTROL SYSTEM DIAGNOSTICS, ACCELERATOR PEDAL POSITION SENSOR/IVS SWITCH (APS/IVS) - TWO SPEED AXLE SPEEDOMETER CIRCUIT - EXTENDED DESCRIPTION

svcproc.title: EXTENDED DESCRIPTION

note.para: The purpose of this section is to diagnose the two speed interface with the speedometer. This section does not diagnose two speed axle operation.

svcproc.para: The vehicle speed sensor reads the revolutions of the transmission speedometer gear and sends a signal to the ECM. ECM programming includes the high and low rear axle ratios. The ECM uses the sensor input and rear axle rations to calculate the speedometer signal, depending on which range the vehicle is operating in. When voltage is applied to ECM pin 28 from the two speed circuit, the ECM uses the low ratio.

The Two Speed Axle switch receives ACC. power from 10A fuse F14. This is a normally open switch with "High" as the normal operating position. With the Two-Speed switch in the "Low" position, 12V accessory power is applied through ECM connector (381) at ECM pin 28.
